model.dek: Candice Bergen, Julianne Moore, Julian Fellowes, Dominic West, Richard Linklater, and George Lucas divulge the past lives of their historic houses

items.title: dam-images-daily-2015-01-tif-celebrity-homes-celebrities-historic-homes-inquistive-guest-01-moore.jpg
items.caption: At a Cinema Society screening of *Still Alice,* a film that has propelled __Julianne Moore__ to her fifth Oscar nomination, the actress lit up when I asked about her historic townhouse. “It was built in 1839 by a middle-class merchant next to a warehouse near the waterfront in New York.” Moore avoided over-restoring it, retaining features such as the gently settled historic feel of stairwells, for example. “It became a boardinghouse, and there are rumors that the author James Baldwin once stayed there. Then it was turned into apartments, and when I bought it, David Lauren [Ralph Lauren’s son] was my tenant.”

items.title: dam-images-daily-2015-01-tif-celebrity-homes-celebrities-historic-homes-inquistive-guest-02-fellowes.jpg
items.caption:
During the BAFTA Tea at the Four Seasons hotel in Los Angeles, *Downton Abbey* creator __Julian Fellowes__ discussed Stafford House, his country residence in Dorset. “It’s quite an old house, built in 1460,” he said. “And then it was tarted up by the Elizabethans, and then it was tarted up by the Caroleans, and then it was tarted up during the Regency. And then it was turned around and had a new front put on it by the Victorians. So it’s really been through the mill. But Thomas Hardy used to come and write in our morning room. He wrote a particularly long short story, almost a novelette, called *The Waiting Supper,* which is set in our house. And, in fact, our local church in our village is where Angel Clare marries Tess of the d’Urbervilles.”



Fellowes is pictured here with his wife, Emma Fellowes.

items.title: dam-images-daily-2015-01-tif-celebrity-homes-celebrities-historic-homes-inquistive-guest-03-fellowes.jpg
items.caption: At the Art of Elysium Heaven gala, __Elijah Wood__ said that his house in L.A. was built in the 1920s. “It’s an old Craftsman. But I have another house that was built in the 1890s in a small Texas town. It’s sort of classic Victorian, and it was moved to Austin by the prior owners. I love the Victorian architecture—it has parlor rooms, hardwood floors, and porches.”

items.title: dam-images-daily-2015-01-tif-celebrity-homes-celebrities-historic-homes-inquistive-guest-04-bergen.jpg
items.caption:
At the Museum of the Moving Image, __Candice Bergen__ brought up her storybook manor near Cahors, complete with turrets. “It’s a house in France that’s [15th century](/celebrity-homes/1988/candice-bergen-article-061988). It has a great history.”



Bergen is pictured here with her husband, Marshall Rose.

items.title: dam-images-daily-2015-01-tif-celebrity-homes-celebrities-historic-homes-inquistive-guest-05-barker.jpg
items.caption:
__Nigel Barker,__ of *America’s Next Top Model,* also attending the Museum of the Moving Image event, discussed the 700-year-old house where he grew up in southwest England. “It started off as a barn, was converted to a house with a thatched roof, and over the years was constantly added onto,” he said. “People were so small back then, it was very, very low, and everyone in my family is very, very tall. We’re only about a mile from Stonehenge. And we would find old English coins, Anglo-Saxon bits and pieces all the time.”



Barker is pictured here with his wife, Cristen Barker.

items.title: dam-images-daily-2015-01-tif-celebrity-homes-celebrities-historic-homes-inquistive-guest-06-barker.jpg
items.caption: During the Cinema Society screening of *Strange Magic,* __George Lucas’s__ 15-year animated passion project, Lucas described yet another passion project, his 16th-century former monastery in Passignano, Umbria, [Il Convento dei Cappucini](http://www.redsavannah.com/villas-ski/europe/italy/umbria/il-convento-dei-cappuccini/overview/), which long served as a hostel for pilgrimages to Rome. “It’s very modest—it was literally a monastery for Capuchin monks. It’s very beautiful and humble, like a hotel. People can rent by the week.” The bucolic estate overlooks Lake Trasimeno, where St. Francis of Assisi is said to have observed Lent in 1211.

items.title: dam-images-daily-2015-01-tif-celebrity-homes-celebrities-historic-homes-inquistive-guest-07-gervais.jpg
items.caption:
At the Weinstein Golden Globes after-party, actor and comedian __Ricky Gervais__ mentioned that his house in England was built in 1889. Jane Fallon, his partner, pointed out that one previous resident was a founder of the League Against Cruel Sports, an anti-hunting organization, which opposes bullfighting and dogfighting—two animal-rights issues Gervais also happens to champion. “And it’s the highest point in London,” Gervais said. “So if there was a great flood, I’d be like Noah, saving animals and people. No, just animals . . . people, get out!”



Gervais is pictured here with Jane Fallon.

items.title: dam-images-daily-2015-01-tif-celebrity-homes-celebrities-historic-homes-inquistive-guest-08-linklater.jpg
items.caption: Also at the Golden Globes, __Richard Linklater__ mentioned that his house in Austin was built in 1917, but its claim to fame, besides him, of course, is that it was previously inhabited by a rock star. “Bob Mould of Hüsker Dü lived there for a while,” noted the Oscar-nominated director of *Boyhood.*

items.title: dam-images-daily-2015-01-tif-celebrity-homes-celebrities-historic-homes-inquistive-guest-09-west.jpg
items.caption: *The Affair’*s __Dominic West,__ who is married to Catherine Fitzgerald, the daughter of the late 29th Knight of Glin, lives at his wife’s family’s estate. “It’s on the west coast of Ireland in Glin, County Limerick, and they’ve been there for 700 years. There are two Knights of Glin in particular that I can recall. One of them was called the Cracked Knight [John Fraunceis Eyre Fitzgerald, the 25th Knight of Glin], who was a lunatic.” He is said to have ridden his horse up the back stairs. “And the other one was called the Knight of the Women, who fathered all the children in the town [an alleged 15]. But the castle is in very good nick.”
